description:
In nova/conf/paths.py, I can read:

path_opts = [
    cfg.StrOpt('pybasedir',
               default=os.path.abspath(os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__),
                                                    '../../')),
               help='Directory where the nova python module is installed'),

This means that, wherever nova source code is installed to generate nova.conf is going to be the default value for pybasedir. This has all the chances in the world to be a wrong value. For example, if building from /home/zigo/sources/mitaka/nova/nova, we end up with:

# Directory where the nova python module is installed (string value)
#pybasedir = /home/zigo/sources/openstack/mitaka/nova/build-area/nova-13.0.0/debian/tmp/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages

instead of:
#pybasedir = /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages

Unfortunately, this ends up in the package.
title: wrong default value for $pybasedir

comments.content:
Yeah, we have the same issue in the job that generates the nova.conf.sample for our docs:

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/sample_config.html

# Directory where the nova python module is installed (string value)
#pybasedir = /home/jenkins/workspace/nova-docs

What do you expect to be done here? Default to None?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content: FYI, I of course fixed that in the Debian package. However, I'd still prefer default to None indeed, as this would force users to set a correct value, and avoid build non-reproducibility.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~thomas-goirand

comments.content:
We explicitly don't want to force users to set a value manually. The whole point is the code has sane defaults.

What you probably actually want is a version or flag on oslo.config that doesn't do interpolation, so that is still $pybasedir in the example.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague

comments.content:
The actual bug, if we were going to go down that path, would be eliminate this entirely. This is basically used to find template files:

ribos:~/.../openstack/nova/nova(master)> git grep basedir_def 
conf/cloudpipe.py:        default=paths.basedir_def('nova/cloudpipe/bootscript.template'),
conf/paths.py:def basedir_def(*args):
conf/virt.py:    default=paths.basedir_def('nova/virt/interfaces.template'),
conf/xvp.py:               default=paths.basedir_def('nova/console/xvp.conf.template'),


These could be more properly registered as python resources, and we could use the python infrastructure itself to find them.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague
